positive.review:
When this game was new, I was blown away. There's not nearly as much wait time between rounds for the game to calculate and move stuff.

Only thing I'm not a fan of is the effects of global warming.
It's playable!  Yes, cartoonish.  But it takes only 3-4 hours to play a complete game, which is far less than Civ 5, 6 or especially 7.  Many turns in Civ 4 take only seconds.

I've played all the Civ series except VII (I don't get the trading civs in the middle of the game thing--I have zero interest in that). Civ Four is my favorite of all of them. It's masterfully balanced and not so complicated that it becomes a job playing it. The UI gives you just enough information to keep moving toward your strategy, but not enough that your gameplay is a lock. The graphics are dated, but after a while, you don't notice. Gameplay is fun; if you don't pay attention to the stats, you'll be in a world of hurt and wondering how you got there. Leonard Nimoy's voice-over through the game is one of my favorite parts of playing Civ IV. Classy and classic, I definitely recommend.
Civilization! What's not to love about this gane? Build, expand, grow, improve, conquer. I really liked 4 because of it's common roots with the old, while looking nicer in the overall.
the only game where i can play as England, fight the inca, take one of there city's and take Stonehenge from it. And i wouldn't have it any other way.

I started civilization with possibly 4 but got more into it with revolution for the 360 and ds. one of the most frustrating parts of civilization is the worker but this can be largely automated in 4. in civ 4 like revolution you can memorize the tech tree path to more efficiently get to space travel and win a tech victory. although workers are tedious it adds slightly more depth than revolution. although it really needs to be more clear how to use gold to rush units. i think you just click on the unit its not clear. im using the standing armies mod from civfanatics so that may be why.

I WILL 100% EVERYTHING IN THIS PEAK GAME
WHEN I REACH 1000 HOURS I'LL MAKE A JOKE

Baba yetu, yetu uliye mbinguni
Yetu, yetu, amina
Baba yetu, yetu uliye
Better than I was expecting as an old Civ Player
great game its a little bit like aoe2de
civ4 might be old, but it is _my_ fav version of civ. :)
Great game
the graphic needs to update
classic
good stuff
classic
oldie but goodie
Feed the Beast!
Spock!

When this game was new, I was blown away. There's not nearly as much wait time between rounds for the game to calculate and move stuff.

Only thing I'm not a fan of is the effects of global warming.
Honestly this was one of the first turn based games I played as a kid. I have spent hundreds of hours at least. Music is 10/10 love Chris Tin music.

After 1,000+ hours across Civ IV - VI, I can happily say that IV is the best in the series. The AI is brutal even on normal difficulties and can't be walked over easily like in V and VI. The tech tree is also the best in my opinion and the different traits and starting technologies for each leader/civilization provide a surprising amount of variety.

Buying Civ IV at a book fair at my middle school in 2006 may be one of the best decision I ever made.
Involving game with much variation allowed for players with no experience to ultimate challenge.
It's playable!  Yes, cartoonish.  But it takes only 3-4 hours to play a complete game, which is far less than Civ 5, 6 or especially 7.  Many turns in Civ 4 take only seconds.

I've played all the Civ series except VII (I don't get the trading civs in the middle of the game thing--I have zero interest in that). Civ Four is my favorite of all of them. It's masterfully balanced and not so complicated that it becomes a job playing it. The UI gives you just enough information to keep moving toward your strategy, but not enough that your gameplay is a lock. The graphics are dated, but after a while, you don't notice. Gameplay is fun; if you don't pay attention to the stats, you'll be in a world of hurt and wondering how you got there. Leonard Nimoy's voice-over through the game is one of my favorite parts of playing Civ IV. Classy and classic, I definitely recommend.
Civilization! What's not to love about this gane? Build, expand, grow, improve, conquer. I really liked 4 because of it's common roots with the old, while looking nicer in the overall.
the only game where i can play as England, fight the inca, take one of there city's and take Stonehenge from it. And i wouldn't have it any other way.

I started civilization with possibly 4 but got more into it with revolution for the 360 and ds. one of the most frustrating parts of civilization is the worker but this can be largely automated in 4. in civ 4 like revolution you can memorize the tech tree path to more efficiently get to space travel and win a tech victory. although workers are tedious it adds slightly more depth than revolution. although it really needs to be more clear how to use gold to rush units. i think you just click on the unit its not clear. im using the standing armies mod from civfanatics so that may be why.
Best Civ, I had it on disc and spent thousands of hours easy.

AI Overview
Sid Meier's Civilization IV is widely considered the best game in the series by critical consensus, celebrated for its deep gameplay, strong AI, and balanced mechanics, while Sid Meier's Civilization VI is a recommended option for its accessibility, unique mechanics, and modernity, especially for new players. The "best" choice ultimately depends on individual player preferences for depth, modern features, or a balance between older and newer styles.
This game is continuously engaging and entertaining

I WILL 100% EVERYTHING IN THIS PEAK GAME
WHEN I REACH 1000 HOURS I'LL MAKE A JOKE
I've been playing for years, and it is such a wonderful time sink.

Baba yetu, yetu uliye mbinguni
Yetu, yetu, amina
Baba yetu, yetu uliye
Civ 4 is THE version of the game.  The rest pale in comparison
EASY TURN BASED GAME WITH LOTS OF IN GAME OPTIONS AND DIFFERENT MAPS
Better than I was expecting as an old Civ Player
great game its a little bit like aoe2de
Fun interactive gameplay.  Easy to learn.
civ4 might be old, but it is _my_ fav version of civ. :)
it moves quickly through the game
One of the best civs. Holds up after all these years.
Fun game :D
Love it!
Great game

negative.review: It automatically does stuff but unlike Warcraft and Starcraft I don't see how to create workers, military, buildings, etc.  I just watch it to its boring improvements.
Once a great game.  Does not run on Windows 11.  Don't waste your money!

Absolute garbage game. Another clunky, bloated, nonsensical, unintuitive mess from Sid Meier - who is easily the most overrated developer ever. Why they slap this nerd's name on everything is beyond me. If I ever made anything this cruddy, I wouldn't want my name anywhere near it.

It's long, it's dull, it's tedious as all hell and it's pointless. It's no different than any cheap Facebook/IOS game ever and it wastes your time just as much.
Kepps crashing
ГОВНО

in confronto a Civ 2 e Civ 3 è davvero orrendo, non c'è un punto negativo, è proprio brutto da vedere e giocare nell'insieme, conquistare non da soddisfazione.
è un Civ instupidito, è un gioco che sembra quasi di produzione amatoriale rispetto a Civ 3.

I am sure now... the computer CHEATS, and cheats with  no remorse... i am talking about before your eyes, in broad daylight, unhidden, monty python style persuading you that the parrot is alive... that kind of cheating.. It just creates S***LOAD of units for AI in single turn. It just creates what it needs. Its like that rubber band S**** style of racing in NFS... insulting, like you wont notice. Ruins gameplay, immersion, tactics.... just to create tense situatons to keep you on your toes... and logic and planing does not help there. I am going back to CIV 2.
It automatically does stuff but unlike Warcraft and Starcraft I don't see how to create workers, military, buildings, etc.  I just watch it to its boring improvements.
Once a great game.  Does not run on Windows 11.  Don't waste your money!

Absolute garbage game. Another clunky, bloated, nonsensical, unintuitive mess from Sid Meier - who is easily the most overrated developer ever. Why they slap this nerd's name on everything is beyond me. If I ever made anything this cruddy, I wouldn't want my name anywhere near it.

It's long, it's dull, it's tedious as all hell and it's pointless. It's no different than any cheap Facebook/IOS game ever and it wastes your time just as much.

I have been a civ fan since 1990's. I have bought every version ever made. But today when I decided to play it told me my pc was not powerfull enough. a game what maybe 15 yo? a game that I bought all those years ago and have played on the current machine for years.
asus x99-A II mb with a 5960x cpu clocked at 4g, 128 GB ddr4 ram, nvme pcie 4 x4 and a pair of Titan maxwell gpu's.
I own newer versions of the game but I like to play this one.
No more you got the last you will ever get.
Remember this crap folks, its yours till the decide its not.
fua

è un Civ instupidito, è un gioco che sembra quasi di produzione amatoriale rispetto a Civ 3.

I am sure now... the computer CHEATS, and cheats with  no remorse... i am talking about before your eyes, in broad daylight, unhidden, monty python style persuading you that the parrot is alive... that kind of cheating.. It just creates S***LOAD of units for AI in single turn. It just creates what it needs. Its like that rubber band S**** style of racing in NFS... insulting, like you wont notice. Ruins gameplay, immersion, tactics.... just to create tense situatons to keep you on your toes... and logic and planing does not help there. I am going back to CIV 2.
It automatically does stuff but unlike Warcraft and Starcraft I don't see how to create workers, military, buildings, etc.  I just watch it to its boring improvements.
Once a great game.  Does not run on Windows 11.  Don't waste your money!

Absolute garbage game. Another clunky, bloated, nonsensical, unintuitive mess from Sid Meier - who is easily the most overrated developer ever. Why they slap this nerd's name on everything is beyond me. If I ever made anything this cruddy, I wouldn't want my name anywhere near it.

It's long, it's dull, it's tedious as all hell and it's pointless. It's no different than any cheap Facebook/IOS game ever and it wastes your time just as much.

I have been a civ fan since 1990's. I have bought every version ever made. But today when I decided to play it told me my pc was not powerfull enough. a game what maybe 15 yo? a game that I bought all those years ago and have played on the current machine for years.
asus x99-A II mb with a 5960x cpu clocked at 4g, 128 GB ddr4 ram, nvme pcie 4 x4 and a pair of Titan maxwell gpu's.
I own newer versions of the game but I like to play this one.
No more you got the last you will ever get.
Remember this crap folks, its yours till the decide its not.
fua
